business.headline: Red flags turn green on Dalal Street: Will the stock market bull run continue?Stock market rally today: With today's rebound, both indices have nearly erased most of the losses suffered in the first two months of 2025. It may be noted that the total market capitalisation of all BSE-listed firms swelled by over Rs 5 lakh crore.

Volkswagen tax case: Why government stands firm on $1.4 billion demandThe government's tax demand is against Skoda Auto Volkswagen India, which is accused of wrongly classifying imported parts for some Audi, VW and Skoda cars to avoid paying higher import taxes.

Sensex surges 1,000 points as FIIs chase Dalal Street rallyBull run on Dalal Street: The S&P BSE Senses added 1,003.06 points to 77,908.57, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 286.95 points to 23,637.35 as of 12:37 pm.

Is India's middle class losing momentum? See what this expert saysThe rise of automation is a growing threat to jobs. Machines are replacing traditional roles in both factories and offices. The next phase of automation, powered by generative AI, is expected to accelerate job displacement across multiple sectors, Saurabh Mukherjea said.

Why foreign investors are rushing back to bet on Dalal Street FIIs returning to Dalal Street has given a sharp boost to domestic investors, with the main indices extending gains for the sixth consecutive session. The S&P BSE Sensex was up 950 points and Nifty rose 273 points.

Stock market rally: Check top gainers and losers on Dalal StreetSensex surged over 800 points to surpass the 77,700 mark, and Nifty jumped over 200 points to trade above the 23,500 level as Dalal Street continued its winning streak.

Why Trump's tariffs aren't spooking Dalal Street investors anymoreForeign investors are back, and markets are rallying. But with Trump's reciprocal tariffs set for April 2, will the optimism last, or is another sell-off on the way?

Sensex jumps over 1,000 points, extends rally: 5 things to knowStock Market Today: As of 11:06 am, the S&P BSE Sensex went up by 1000.10 points to reach 77,905.61. At the same time, the NSE Nifty50 increased by 289.85 points to 23,640.25.
NCC share price jumps 5% after Rs 1,480 crore hospital redevelopment orderNCC Ltd's stock price jumped in early trade after the company secured a contract worth Rs 1,480 crore.

Defence stocks are rising again. Is BHEL a good buy after recent order wins?Having declined over 24% in the past six months and over 9% in 2025, the stock has finally started showing signs of recovery. In the past month it has gained 11% and nearly 8% in the past five trading sessions.
Sensex, Nifty gain as energy stocks rally and foreign inflows surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 579.88 points to 77,485.39, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 160.85 points to 23,511.25 as of 9:26 AM.

Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher: How to trade on Dalal Street today?Dalal Street is expected to open higher as the overall market sentiment remains positive, with traders watching key levels for further movement.

Sensex, Nifty opening prediction on March 24: What to expect from D-Street todayNifty50 posted its biggest weekly gain in over four years, driven by renewed interest from foreign investors and expectations that the recent market decline has come to an end.

Stocks to watch on March 24: RIL, Ola, Raymond, Adani Green, Mahindra & MahindraAs markets resume trading, several stocks will be in focus due to key developments. These include Reliance Industries, Mahindra & Mahindra, Ola Electric, Adani Green, Adani Enterprises, NCC, Dr. Reddy's, Max Healthcare.

Kumar Mangalam Birla wins Business Today's Business Icon of the Year awardThe award recognises not only Kumar Mangalam Birla's achievements over the past three decades since he took over the reins of his family business at the tender age of 28, but also showcases his visionary approach in changing times.

Kumar Mangalam Birla honoured with Business Icon of the Year at BT MindRushAt Business Today MindRush 2025, Aditya Birla Group Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla was honoured with the 'Business Icon of the Year' award.

What does Tesla entry mean for India's automotive industry? Nitin Gadkari answersAt the Business Today Mindrush 2025 forum, Nitin Gadkari expressed confidence that India's automotive industry would become the second largest in the world in the next few years.

India on track to become 'Viksit Bharat' by 2047, says Kumar Mangalam BirlaAditya Birla Group Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla said India is on track for Viksit Bharat 2047, crediting policy stability, infrastructure growth, and economic momentum.

Government withdraws 20% duty on Onion export, to be effective from April 1The Centre has removed the 20 per cent export duty on onions, effective April 1. The duty, imposed to ensure domestic availability, had been in place since September 2024. Despite restrictions, onion exports saw significant growth.

Overconfidence leading to F&O losses for retail investors, says Sebi chiefTuhin Kanta Pandey said that studies conducted by the market regulator, Sebi, show that 90% of retail investors lose money in the futures and options (F&O) segment.

What should market traders be worried about today? Sebi chief answersSebi chief Tuhin Kanta Pandey pointed to India's efforts to negotiate bilateral trade agreements with the United States and pursue free trade agreements with various other nations as examples of strategic responses to global uncertainty.

Marico Chairman Harsh Mariwala says war for talent as crucial as market shareMarico Chairman Harsh Mariwala urged entrepreneurs to focus on building strong teams, saying the competition for skilled professionals is intense.

Motilal Oswal explains why retail investors fail to make money from stock marketMotilal Oswal cautioned that most retail investors are engaging in speculative short-term trading or investing in unknown companies, which often leads to losses.
NSE CEO Ashish Chauhan warns retail investors against derivatives tradingNSE chief Ashish Chauhan also advised investors not to believe market tips and discussions on social media platforms.

Old vs new tax regime: Which one should you opt for in 2025-26?While the old tax regime promotes savings through tax benefits, the new one is simpler, involves less paperwork and reduces the chances of tax fraud.

Old vs new income tax regime: What to choose if you earn Rs 50 lakh per yearTaxpayers should consider a few key factors before making a choice. The old regime allows deductions, whereas the new regime offers lower tax rates but no major deductions.
Sensex closes over 500 points, Nifty above 23,300; NTPC gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 557.45 points to end at 76,905.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 159.75 points to close at 23,350.40.

Government to lapse $23 billion scheme to boost domestic manufacturing: ReportThe Production-Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme, introduced in 2020, aimed to increase manufacturing's share of India's economy to 25% by 2025.

SBI Card Flexipay: Know how to convert credit card payments into EMIsOne can convert transactions of Rs 500 or more into EMIs under SBI Card's Flexipay option. It offers multiple repayment tenure options, such as three, six, nine, 12, 18 and 24 months.

Smallcap, midcap stocks gain momentum. Good news for mutual funds too?Given the correction, some analysts have indicated that quality smallcap and midcap stocks could start regaining some momentum. But does this apply to smallcap and midcap mutual funds too?

Rupee heads for best week in 2 years as dollar inflows riseAt 1 pm, the rupee was trading at 86.07 against the US dollar, extending its weekly gain to 0.72%. This marks the strongest weekly performance for the rupee since 2022.

Is the foreign selling crisis finally over on Dalal Street?Foreign investors turned net buyers in two of the last four sessions, sparking a market rally. While selling pressure has eased, is the months-long foreign outflow crisis finally coming to an end?

Morgan Stanley to layoff 2,000 employees to boost efficiencySeveral renowned banks have been reducing their workforce recently as they brace for economic uncertainty following President Donald Trump's newly announced trade tariffs.

Tata Group quietly becomes Tesla's global supplier: ReportTata firms have already signed global agreements with Tesla and are supplying various parts and services and their involvement is expected to grow further.

Unified Pension Scheme: Who can join and how much to contributeUPS will be available to central government employees who meet specific criteria. This includes existing employees under NPS as of 1st April 2025. It also includes newly recruited employees joining central government services on or after April 1, 2025.
Can AI pick winning stocks on Dalal Street? Check out these toolsOne of the major advantages of using AI is that it takes care of the labour-intensive aspects of trading efficiently, as per experts.

Pakistan plans to legalise cryptocurrency to tackle economic slowdownNearly 15-20 million Pakistanis are already trading digital assets. Further, countries like the US and UAE are embracing crypto-friendly policies, making it crucial for Pakistan to stay competitive.

Sensex climbs over 600 points. Check key reasons behind stock market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 604.77 points to trade at 76,952.83 at 12:37 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 175.35 points to 23,366. Adding to the cheer was the continued rally in smallcap and midcap segments.

Bajaj Finance shares rally over 3% to reach record high, analysts bullishShares of the non-banking financial company rose 3.5% in early trade to reach a day's high of 9,070. At around 10:35 am, shares of the company were trading 2.43% higher at Rs 8,891.15 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
RVNL shares rise 4% as railway PSU bags Rs 555 crore project. Check detailsThe shares of RVNL were trading 4.18% higher at Rs 373 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

entertainment.headline: Prateik Smita Patil drops Babbar, wife Priya says 'that family was never there'Prateik Babbar has dropped his father's surname, adopted his mother's name and will be known as Prateik Smita Patil. His wife, Priya Banerjee, also defended not calling the Babbars to their wedding.

Hina Khan expresses happiness as her hair grows after chemotherapyTelevision star Hina Khan, who has been diagnosed with cancer, recently debuted her new look during an awards ceremony. She expressed her happiness at the regrowth of her hair post-chemotherapy.

Case against Bigg Boss Kannada contestants for posing with arms on social mediaAn FIR was filed against two past contestants of reality show Bigg Boss Kannada for posing with a weapon, raising concerns for public safety.

Kesari 2 teaser: Akshay Kumar promises powerful retelling of Jallianwala BaghThe teaser for Akshay Kumar's Kesari Chapter 2: The Untold Story of Jallianwala Bagh was released on Monday. It explores the events following the massacre, with Akshay Kumar portraying Sir C Sankaran Nair.

Mahira Khan reunites with Raees co-star SRK on set, but there's a twistPakistani actor Mahira Khan reunited with Shah Rukh Khan on a shooting set. The actor's pictures on social media have sparked excitement among fans.

Dia Mirza demands apology from media after CBI's clean chit to Rhea ChakrabortyThe CBI filed a closure report to Mumbai court, stating that no evidence was found to establish any foul play behind actor Sushant Singh Rajput's death. Actor Dia Mirza demanded an apology from the media for the 'anguish' caused  to Rhea Chakraborty and her family during trial.

Sooraj Barjatya recalls narrating Uunchai script to Big B: Took anxiety pillsFilmmaker Sooraj Barjatya opened up about his experience of narrating the script of Uunchai to Amitabh Bachchan. The director admitted to taking anxiety pills to calm his nerves during the process.

'Papa, Kattapaa': How Salman Khan introduced Sathyaraj to father Salim KhanActor Sathyaraj spoke about how Salman Khan introduced him to his father, Salim Khan, at the Sikandar trailer launch. The actor will be seen playing the antagonist in AR Murugadoss's Sikandar.

Deepika Padukone calls out Oscars for snubbing Indian films, recalls RRR momentActor Deepika Padukone expressed her disappointment over India's repeated snubs at the Oscars. She believes that Indian films and talent have been overlooked too many times by the prestigious awards.

Tamannaah defends playing Shiva Shakti in Odela 2, discusses 'milky beauty' tagActor Tamannaah Bhatia will be seen as sadhvi Shiva Shakti in her upcoming Telugu film, Odela 2. She defended director Ashok's choice and said that the 'milky beauty' tag is not something to be ashamed of.

Amitabh Bachchan, Rani Mukerji's Black co-star is now married, see first picsAmitabh Bachchan's Black co-star Ayesha Kapur got married to her longtime boyfriend Adam Oberoi in Delhi on March 23. The first picture of the couple as husband and wife is finally out.

Brad Pitt faces legal hurdle over faulty houses for Hurricane Katrina victimsBrad Pitt is facing a significant legal challenge as a lawsuit filed by Hurricane Katrina victims progresses. The actor's charitable housing project in New Orleans has come under scrutiny.

Actors Nayanthara, Nivin Pauly wrap Dear Students shootActors Nayanthara and Nivin Pauly have completed filming for their upcoming movie, Dear Students. On Sunday, they shared a fun video celebrating the occasion with a party alongside the cast and crew.

BB 18's Mannara Chopra criticises airline for denying boarding, gets trolledActor Mannara Chopra recently slammed an airline for not allowing her to board the flight. The actor shared her ordeal in a video on social media.

KJo calls Adolescence 'blasterclass' for parents, terms the show as forever lessonFilmmaker Karan Johar is the latest celebrity to share his review on Netflix's Adolescence. The director-producer called it a 'forever lesson' and a 'loud wake up call to parents'.

Viral: David Warner brings 'Pushpa' magic to Telugu debut film eventCricketer David Warner recreated the steps of the song 'Srivalli' from Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa: The Rise' at the event of his Telugu debut film, Robinhood. The cricketer will play a cameo in the film.

Anirudh Ravichander's roaring Hukum show sets Chepauk ablaze before CSK vs MISinger and composer Anirudh Ravichander set Chepauk Stadium ablaze with his electrifying 'Badass' performance on Sunday. He energised the crowd with his act ahead of the CSK vs MI match, creating an electrifying atmosphere.

Rashmika on working with Salman Khan in Sikandar: What could be bigger than thatActor Rashmika Mandanna is thrilled as she prepares for the grand release of Sikandar, where she stars alongside Salman Khan. Set to hit theatres on March 30, the film marks their first collaboration.

Salman Khan on 31-year age-gap with Rashmika: Will even work with her daughterSalman Khan addressed trolls over his tired look and age-gap criticism, saying he'll work with his heroines' daughters too. He also joked about proving to social media that he's still around.

general news.headline: Won't tolerate this, Kunal Kamra should apologise: Devendra Fadnavis on joke rowMaharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis slammed stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra amid a row over his joke on Eknath Shinde, saying no insults or defamatory remarks against leaders will be tolerated.

A gaddar is a gaddar: Uddhav Thackeray backs comic Kunal Kamra amid row over 'traitor' jibe at Eknath ShindeA gaddar is a gaddar: Uddhav Thackeray backs comic Kunal Kamra amid row over 'traitor' jibe at Eknath Shinde

Delhi High Court derosters Justice Varma after cash recovered from his homeDelhi HC judge Yashwant Varma's judicial duties were withdrawn after cash was found at his residence following a fire incident.

Tech entrepreneur alleges harassment by wife, Chennai cops over child custodyThe founder of the software company Rippling and tech entrepreneur Prasanna Sankar made serious allegations against his estranged wife, amid their divorce and custody battle. While he claimed harassment by the police, the wife accused him of financial and sexual misconduct.

Why Rohit Sharma's Champions Trophy method should take a backseat in IPL 2025Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma was dismissed for a four-ball duck in the opening game of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Chennai Super Kings (CSK). After the game, former cricketers Krishnamachari Srikkanth and Shane Watson had some suggestions for Rohit on his approach in recent times.

After Ukraine, US officials hold talks with Russia to discuss ceasefire: ReportAfter holding talks with Ukraine on Sunday, US delegations met Russian officials in Saudi Arabia today to discuss partial ceasefire in the war.

Insult or freedom of speech? Sena vs Sena over Kunal Kamra's Eknath Shinde jokeThe Shinde Camp slammed Kunal Kamra's remarks on Eknath Shinde as "insult" while the leaders of the Uddhav Thackeray camp extended support to the comedian.

Ball tampering in El Clasico? Fans accuse CSK of malpractice as video goes viralA section of fans is accusing the Chennai Super Kings of tampering with the ball during their clash against Mumbai Indians at Chepauk on Sunday, March 23. CSK won the match to start their campaign in fine fashion.

Should housing societies have right to ban certain types of food? What India thinksIndia Today's inaugural Gross Domestic Behaviour (GDB) survey found 54 per cent of the respondents supported prohibition on certain types of food by housing societies.

Sensex surges 1,000 points as FIIs chase Dalal Street rallyBull run on Dalal Street: The S&P BSE Senses added 1,003.06 points to 77,908.57, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 286.95 points to 23,637.35 as of 12:37 pm.

Sena worker's 'only trailer' warning to Kunal Kamra after vandalism in joke rowIn an open threat to stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra, Shiv Sena Yuva Sena (Shinde faction) general secretary Rahool Kanal said the vandalism of a Mumbai studio and a hotel amid the joke row, was only a "trailer".

Who is Prasanna Sankar, Rippling co-founder engaged in custody battle with wife?Tech entrepreneur Prasanna Sankar accused his estranged wife of harassing him amid an acrimonious divorce and custody battle. In a series of tweets, he described the events that followed after he found out that his wife was having an affair. But who is his tech entrepreneur?
Can Aaryan Shukla's maths technique make your child a prodigy?Aaryan Shukla's mental maths skills stunned one and all, including Anand Mahindra. Can the technique turn your child into a prodigy too?

Chaos in Parliament over Karnataka Muslim quota, BJP says Congress dividing IndiaThe Karnataka State Cabinet earlier approved an amendment to the Karnataka Transparency in Public Procurement (KTPP) Act, which aims to provide a four percent reservation in tenders to minority contractors.

Kunal Kamra mocks Eknath Shinde, 11 Sena workers arrested for ransacking venueKamra, known for his witty remarks and sharp commentary, is now embroiled in controversy over a video in which he is seen mocking Eknath Shinde. 11 Sena workers were arrested for vandalism.
The weight-loss drug dilemma: What happens when you stop?While weight-loss drugs provide temporary solutions, experts stress lifestyle changes as the most effective way to maintain a healthy weight.

Tiger Woods reveals he is dating Donald Trump's ex-daughter-in-lawTiger Woods, the 82-time TOUR winner, confirmed his relationship with Donald Trump's ex-daughter-in-law Vanessa Trump after posting a couple of pictures on his social media account.

From the India Today archives (2022) | Prayers in conflict: The mandir-masjid warsIt was supposed to stop with Ayodhya. But Kashi, Mathura, Sambhal and a flurry of other mandir-masjid disputes signal a new phase of Hindu revivalism

12-year-old builds nuclear fusion reactor, gets visit from FBI12-year-old Jackson Oswalt, from Memphis, US, has built a nuclear fusion reactor in his bedroom and made a Guinness World Record for the youngest person to achieve fusion. Later on, he got a visit from the FBI to make sure all was good.

Meerut murder case: Muskan's parents disown her, refuse to provide legal helpSaurabh was allegedly murdered by his wife and her lover, with his dismembered body sealed inside a plastic drum filled with cement in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. The case came to light on March 18.

Delhi woman takes the wheel after Uber driver falls ill, urges people to learn drivingA video of a Delhi-based woman driving an Uber cab after the driver fell sick midway has gone viral on social media.

Know your rights, DGCA tells airlines to share passenger info via SMSThe DGCA has mandated Indian airlines to inform passengers about their rights regarding delays, cancellations, denied boarding, and baggage issues. Airlines must share a link to an online passenger charter via SMS, WhatsApp, tickets, and their websites. IndiGo has already started implementing this directive.

sports.headline: BCCI announces central contract for India Women, no Harleen DeolHarleen Deol is the major omission from India Women's central contracts for the 2024-25 announced by the BCCI on Monday. Shreyanka Patil and Titas Sadhu are amongst the new entrants.

IPL 2025: LSG pacer Mayank Yadav's recovery faces setback with fresh injuryJustin Langer revealed that Mayank Yadav has faced a setback in his recovery with a fresh injury. Mayank injured his toe while rehabbing and his return date has been pushed back further.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
